reference.shortdesc: The tasktroubleshooting element contains troubleshooting information that is designed to help users remedy the situation when a task does not complete as expected.

section.title: Usage information
section.note: Do not use <note type="trouble"> inside of the tasktroubleshooting element, because its meaning there would be ambiguous.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The tasktroubleshooting element is specialized from section. It is defined in the task module.

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: .

example.title: Example
example.p: In the following code sample, the tasktroubleshooting element contains brief information that explains the steps that the user can take when the results of a task are not as expected. For a complex remedy, the author could provide a link to another task topic.
example.codeblock:
Adding new user categories ...

The User Type menu displays the new types you added.

If the User Type menu does not display the additions, try one or more of the following:

  • Refresh the page
  • Verify that Add Types window is not still open; if so, go to it and press OK.
